p: The HCV is a major cause of liver disease. The incidence of hepatocellular carcinoma increases in both sexes with increasing age. In HCV patients, the cumulative risk of evolving to hepatocellular carcinoma in the age group between 40 and 74Â years is 21.6% among males and 8.7% among females [ 19]. The main routes of HCV transmission were summarised by the WHO [ 1].
